website_summaries.verdict: A compact electric treadmill that is great for the price. Easily folds down for storing away, and can move around easily with built-in wheels.
pros: Features a max speed of 6.2 miles per hour with 3 built-in training programs
Multifunctional display offers insight into your workout regimen
LCD display is easily programmable and displays speed, distance, heart rate, and calories burned
Running deck is cushioned to relieve fatigue for prolonged use
cons: Some larger and taller users find that this treadmill doesn't meet their requirements

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy my time
customer_reviews.text: Definitely for smaller people (5'5" and under) who want to work out but don't want to go to a gym. Not "gym" quality but good.
customer_reviews.author: Fiona

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble, especially if the user is a senior. The treadmill is very quiet and runs smoothly. I can place my Kindle Fire on the Head Board, as I call it, and walk at a 4 mile pace for 30 continuous minutes, while at the same time watch a movie or just listen to music. 5 stars !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am not happy and will not be buying this treadmill ever again
customer_reviews.text: I bought this treadmill not even two months ago and i started hearing a clicking noise just recently. I looked underneath the treadmill and the platform that supports the belt has cracked completely down the middle. I am not happy and will not be buying this treadmill ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Rounds

customer_reviews.title: If you run like a baby giraffe
customer_reviews.text: If you run like a baby giraffe this may not be the treadmill for you. After 2 minutes I got bucked off for mis-stepping and got thrown against the wall and slowly slid down as I re-evaluated my health goals. The track on this is really narrow be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect beginner treadmill
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this can't be beat. It doesn't have a ton of features, and it is not capable of going very fast (max is 10 kph, about 6 mph), but what it does, it does well. The controls are intuitive. The walking surface operates smoothly and quietly. The height of the handlebars is comfortable (I'm about 5'5"), though not adjustable. If you're looking for features like programmability, variable incline, collapsibility for easy storage, or compatibility with electronic devices, this is not the treadmill for you. If what you need is a very basic treadmill and a low price, I'd recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: ¤ Candi ¤

customer_reviews.title: Stable and good quality. I wanted it for just walking as ...
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so it is for "shorter" people but was exactly what I wanted. Stable and good quality. I wanted it for just walking as I work from home and can't always get out (weather or work). I would definitely recommend this product and this seller.
customer_reviews.author: donnafromdenver

customer_reviews.title: I love the size
customer_reviews.text: I love the size. I needed something not huge and it is just right. I'm 5'1" and it is perfect. I would not recommend it for anyone much taller as the handles are low. It is quiet and seems to work just as it should. The 4 stars are because it does not have an area for holding a book or kindle. Also, the cup holders are shallow so not real good for a water bottle. I researched several smaller treadmills before buying this one and am glad I made this decision. Also, It would be more convenient if the distance and speed were in miles instead of km. I'll just have to keep the calculator handy.
customer_reviews.author: B. Painter

customer_reviews.title: This treadmill is for short people
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill is for runners or short people. I have to hold onto the bars for safety while walking and they are very low so I have to hunch over. I guess I will modify it by adding an elevated cross bar. Also the treadmill has a three position manual elevation but when at the level-est position there is still a small incline. I took care of this by adding a board under the rear of the machine. Plus ++ it is quiet so watching TV is good. The speed read out is in metric. The pulse reader is better than most. It has a nice cushion feel. Two cup holders. Very easy to fold up.
customer_reviews.author: GENE

customer_reviews.title: Awful!!! broke on first use. This ...
customer_reviews.text: Awful!!! broke on first use. This is ok if you are under 125 LBS and want to walk / job.
customer_reviews.author: agreen

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It works great - have to oil it from time to time (more than I'd like to but it's not a big deal)...It is great value - I like how it can measure calories burned, miles walked, time walked. I'm so glad I bought it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Jordan

customer_reviews.title: disappointment
customer_reviews.text: only 13 inch wide belt shuts off easily if you hit side shallow cup holders shuts down in approx. 30 seconds so you cannot keep track of your time and total distance if you want to pause needs frequent lubrication (will start to be noisy) really designed for a kid not an adult
customer_reviews.author: Stanley J Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 runs on me
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. I am only 5'6" and weigh 175 lbs. The board that you run on cracked and broke. You get what you pay for. Cheap junk. The track is also very narrow and small. I kept tripping on the sides of the machine because it is way too narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: It looks small, but it fits just right in for exercise. It is also very easy to assemble and clear instructions. You don't need any overly expensive equipment to exercise on, this one is sufficient and burns calories just as good. Buy this one if you are on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Syein

customer_reviews.title: Small, effective jogging teadmill
customer_reviews.text: I’m really happy with this purchase. I use it to jog, and it’s effective. I am about 5’4” and 140 lbs. I’m not sure this would be a good option for a person who is much larger than that, because it is relatively small. But for what i wanted it for, its great. I was happy that the incline is (manually) adjustable. It’s not a gym quality treadmill, but for a few jogs a week at home, it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: What a great deal! I am so tickled with my purchase! I bought it on a Sunday & it was delivered by that Thursday. It was clearly brand new & it folds up if I need it to. It's plenty big but small enough that it fits comfortably in my bedroom just fine. It's pretty quiet as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: The treadmill is quiet and easy to assemble. However it arrived with a crack on each side of the top of the base. I would have to say it’s made of poor quality and breaks easily, so if you plan on purchasing, just do not fold it to store often, be sure you can leave it out and unfolded 24/7. I can’t return due to the fact I already recycled the huge box after I assembled it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Holden

customer_reviews.title: Small, Simple, Totally Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Tiny! But perfect for me at 5'4". Super light-weight and good quality. Four screws put it together and I can move this baby around the room wherever I want it. Three manual incline settings (kinda like on a lawnmower). Up to 6.2mph only needs 110v. I highly recommend an equipment mat if you have hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Sparrow

customer_reviews.title: so at 6'4" I must stoop to use If the handlebars were simply vertical this would easily solve this issue Would I recommend this product to ...
customer_reviews.text: NOT FANCY! Kinda fragile, but I am not into hardcore running/walking. Being somewhat fragile, I bought the 3 year warranty. I doubt I will ever need more than around 4 MPH. The one major downside is the handlebars are not adjustable, so at 6'4" I must stoop to use If the handlebars were simply vertical this would easily solve this issue Would I recommend this product to a friend who hates formal exercising as much as I do? Yes, with the above comments.
customer_reviews.author: zyzzyva57

customer_reviews.title: It's small, but also lightweight
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't very expensive and was easy to assemble and get up the stairs. It doesn't take up a lot of space. It works. No bells or whistles. I don't like the screw-in tab that keeps it from falling over when you have it folded because you must stand there and unscrew it for a bit, should be spring- loaded. I especially don't like that it is in kilometers instead of miles and there is no apparent way to change that, and I don't like that you have to bend over to the ground to turn the power on.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Schmitz

customer_reviews.title: Poorly packaged
customer_reviews.text: I love it!! Just the right size does not take up much space, easy to move around, it’s quiet and sturdy. I’m 5’7 189 pounds and I ran 2.5 miles comfortably. I def recommend this for someone who doesn’t have access to a gym or simply doesn’t have the time. The only issue I had is that it’s not packaged very well and that allows for damages so there is a small crack on the display panel next to the cup holder and that’s the reason I gave four stars. Other than that, it’s a great buy and well worth it. I am excited to put it to use daily!
customer_reviews.author: Nakia

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the price
customer_reviews.text: This product came almost fully assembled. It's pretty quiet but I've had it for a few months now and it is getting a squeak, probably need to oil the belt. I run 2-3 miles a few times a week or so and I have no real complaints. The tread isn't very wide and I find myself touching the sides from time to time but it's a small treadmill. Luckily, I am only 5'0 tall. The only downside is the buttons turning it on and changing speeds are REALLY loud!! "Yes, everyone in a 1/2 mile radius, I'm running now."
customer_reviews.author: k.meadows

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.
customer_reviews.text: This item did not work. It also arrived with scratches and scuff marks on the top of the display and there was a piece broken off the side. Another reviewer said they opened the casing to make sure all of the wires were connected and not loose. We tried that, but it still would not work. Currently trying to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Auri White

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me? Bought in “good used condition”, this thing isn’t even in working condition. The entire arm holding the panel up is broken away and they tried to rig it together. It looks like they literally threw it into this box. This is the worst purchase I have made, ever, on anything. Now I have to attempt to repackage this big piece of trash so it can be returned. Absolutely ridiculous, buyer beware. You could purchase a treadmill from a garage sale for less and it would be in far better shape than this.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Has several problems: 1) It is very squeaky 2) ...
customer_reviews.text: Has several problems: 1) It is very squeaky 2) The numbers on the screen are also tilted 3) When leaning on the handle bars, it tilts the front towards you (not to the point where you lose balance but it's not 100% stable).
customer_reviews.author: J. Z.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. If you're just looking for a simple treadmill to do light excercise in front of the TV on, like myself this is it. I do wish the power cord was a bit longer though. I personally had to purchase an extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: Truestory

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and movable!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this treadmill about a year ago. I'm a single, empty-nester so I needed something that I could easily assemble and possibly move. I'm also 5'6" so I needed something that could manage my 'stride'. Over the years I've had the highend treadmills that are really good but heavy and immovable by anyone less than moving men. This treadmill is sturdy and movable and works reliably!!! My only wish is that it was not in kilometers!!!! :-( love it!
customer_reviews.author: QueenBee

customer_reviews.title: A little
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill is pretty great so far. Doesn’t take up that much room. I haven’t been able to get it to fold but that’s ok for the moment. It is a little wobbly on the bottom but I might be able to fix that with some furniture stabilizer things. I do wish that the computer info stayed on a bit longer so you could cycle though all the menus to see what you accomplished before quitting.
customer_reviews.author: AnAgileReader

customer_reviews.title: Simple. Functional.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my needs. I wanted something to use in a small home, just for walking. It is simple to use, simple to assemble, simple to fold up. The cup holders are angled rather than straight which could cause a tall water bottle to tip. I don't use them, so no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: truth is logical

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for seniors like me.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Very easy to set up and use. I love that it is compact yet perfectly functional. So easy to lift, turn one knob, and store in the corner. Add to this the fact that it’s quiet running and easy to listen to TV or music. I’m in my mid seventies and I highly recommend this unit. I’m not a runner but I enjoy walking while watching TV. You can definitely jog as it’s very solid.
customer_reviews.author: Keneagle

customer_reviews.title: Great tred mill
customer_reviews.text: Great tred mill! Works beautifully, easy to assemble (little required). I particularly like it because it is not huge and therefore doesn't monopolize the room! Wish they would have an attachment for an iPhone, IPad. Only cup holders provided. But I am being creative!
customer_reviews.author: tuck

customer_reviews.title: Solid starter treadmill
customer_reviews.text: Not very powerful but it's a solid little starter treadmill. Super easy to put together. Has 3 speeds. Pretty quiet considering it's a motorized treadmill. Working for what I wanted & the price is spot on
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: So glad I purchased it for that price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this treadmill for my daughter to use in her cramped room and she loves it because it folds away when not in use. It’s not loud neither. I never know when she’s on it until she tells me she was. She uses it everyday so far with no problems. So glad I purchased it for that price. It was with it!
customer_reviews.author: forme09

customer_reviews.title: Not for tall/heavy people.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent basic treadmill. Worth the money. Small and narrow belt Works great for me, but I'm only 5'4" and 120 pounds. Big stride and heavy... Choose something else. Measures time, distance, speed and calories and heart rate. Only 3 manual incline levels. Works for me...there is 4 feet of snow on the ground here.
customer_reviews.author: shoequeen

customer_reviews.title: ... looking for something to do walking on this is fine. If you are looking to jog on it ...
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for something to do walking on this is fine. If you are looking to jog on it you'd have to take very short strides. It is easy to assemble just 6 bolts and washers, came with an allen wrench so no additional tools were needed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jolin

customer_reviews.title: Badly damaged
customer_reviews.text: It was delivered with parts falling out of damaged box. Had it put together and it works but the frame is dented, cup holder into the console is cracked. There is a big divot on side rail. It works but looks like a old piece of equipment. If this wasn't a large item I would return it. I've had no luck trying to reach Amazon to complain to someone. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: kathy elder

customer_reviews.title: it seems to be just fine. And holds me up well and I am ...
customer_reviews.text: I was so grateful to find a treadmill I could afford; but be aware, this treadmill is very narrow and small. You might want to get a pair of boxing gloves to go with it- I keep hitting my hands on the bars when I walk. Other than that though, it seems to be just fine. And holds me up well and I am over 250 lbs. But hopefully not for long now though. :D
customer_reviews.author: Latesha Stephens

customer_reviews.title: What you’d expect from a budget treadmill
customer_reviews.text: It’s a bit narrow, slightly sluggish at low speeds (can stall motor) and the rails wobble enough that it can be in the way of the track when you fold it up. But all things considered, we’re happy with the dollar per value of this machine. Keep it lubericated and try to check the bolts every now and then. Small form factor makes it nice to store in the corner of a small gym room.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great Treadmill for the money - Running Board Broke after a year
customer_reviews.text: The main plank appears to be made of wood as mine cracked down the center. I'm 215 lbs and run with a light foot. With the appropriate tension as per the instructions, and my body weight of 210 lbs, I'm not sure why this happened but my guess is wood dries out over time and becomes brittle. There's no easy way I can find to contact Merax, I've tried through their website's Contact form, but got no response.
customer_reviews.author: Maura B.

customer_reviews.title: and this is Perfect! It is a little narrow
customer_reviews.text: I live in an apartment building so I was looking for something smaller, and this is Perfect! It is a little narrow, it folds up nicely and works well. They offer a charge for delivery and it was well worth it. I live on the 2nd floor and they brought it all the way up, less hassle for me. It was is so good my grandmother ordered one too.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrshopper

customer_reviews.title: One part of the treadmill was broken when I received ...
customer_reviews.text: One part of the treadmill was broken when I received it. It is working, Since it is heavy thing, it is hard to return. Don't order this treadmill from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice machine, it's very quiet and nice and light compared to other treadmills. However, the calorie count on this machine seems to be a bit off, I know all machines might be slightly different but mine shows a calorie a minute, at the gym I burn 100 calories in 20 minutes. But I do love everything else about this machine! I just have my phone out and ready to count calories and steps! Great buy for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Allina

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: The trademill is very easy to assemble, takes less space. would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K2

customer_reviews.title: was easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived on time, was easy to set up, and functioned fine. The reason I have a problem is because the platform broke on our third session using it. I weigh 228 pounds, and the description made no mention of a weight limit. The speed is also limited to 10kph. This is too slow for my wife and I. The platform is very short and narrow. I didn't really grasp the scale of the product from the pictures. do not let the price entice you, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: joshua Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for casual runners
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a present for a friend and she can't stop raving about how much she likes it. She's not a hard-core runner but likes to exercise and this is perfect for her. Plus she says its very easy to fold up and put in her closet.
customer_reviews.author: mldlylt

customer_reviews.title: Only runs in KM, not great for tall people
customer_reviews.text: Not good for tall people - if you’re around 6’ or above, your stride will have to be shortened just to fit on this. Also only runs in kilometers instead of miles unfortunately, so it’s very slow as well. Takes me almost a minute and a half longer to run a mile on this than it does on the track, and that’s at the highest speed setting. Works well though for what I’ve needed it for, small and fits easily in my apartment. Also very easy to assemble, took ~5–10 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Max Swartz

customer_reviews.title: For what we use it for it is exceptional
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help with my wife's rehab after major back surgery. We don't use it for marathon training, just for being able to exercise by keeping the body parts moving. Virtually no set up involved, you might need a little help in getting it to the location you want to use it in. But as far as working as performing as it is advertised, it does everything. I would highly recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. easy to store. wish the belt was thicker, but over all, it does what you need it to do and I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny Beyerle

customer_reviews.title: Safety problem
customer_reviews.text: Good but there is a significant safety concern because when in the up position bumping it will cause the pin to dislodge and it to come crashing down. Could seriously injure a child.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan M

customer_reviews.title: Compact & Ready To Go!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I expected it to be smaller and compact. This is a great beginner treadmill without all the technology that the others have. The best part is there was barely any assembly involved!
customer_reviews.author: Mama Kalb

customer_reviews.title: It's nice.
customer_reviews.text: Product is nice but price wise I think it is way too high. It does go up against the wall and has wheels to roll it where you want to set it up. A little on the thin size for the belt. If you're a big person you will have a hard time
customer_reviews.author: arlene

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cracked down the middle like the other reviews. Spend a little more and get a decent machine. So bummed!! This is SO UNSAFE! I was rehabbing a knee from surgeries and could have really injured myself.
customer_reviews.author: Kennyandchristina

customer_reviews.title: For a a small apartment or short person
customer_reviews.text: I love this treadmill. However, I am 5’8 and I think it would be better suited for someone shorter. But I knew what I was buying when I purchased it I have a very tiny apartment and I didn’t want to use a lot of space. Besides, I only use the treadmill for walking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would only recommend this for walking
customer_reviews.text: I would only recommend this for walking. It’s really short for running. And if you’re a tall person, it definitely rules you out. Mine came with a cosmetic issue (plastic on the top side was broken), but was not worth dealing with the return. So I kept it.
customer_reviews.author: ShopCrazy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for home gym
customer_reviews.text: This fits nicely in my bedroom, and I can tuck it up and store it in the corner without taking up too much room. The price is right too. Great for days I don't want to walk around outside when the weather is bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how it is so highly rated. Maybe I got a dud. We couldn't assemble it, not because of incompetence, but rather because the parts weren't fitting. Honestly the quality of the product was cheap. Guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: A. C. Duran

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for jogging
customer_reviews.text: It works just fine for regular walking. But once you use it for jogging all sorts of issues come up. Within 5 days of use for jogging there were weird noises and within a week the base board on the treadmill cracked and broke. Also max speed is not 7.5 MPH as advertised. Its 10 KMPH (around 6.3 MPH). Buy it only if you are sure that you wont use it for jogging / running.
customer_reviews.author: Mohan

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with broken plastic covers
customer_reviews.text: I've experienced customer care at many companies and this one truly cares about their customers. I bought this treadmill as a gift and once it arrived with the plastic covers cracked I contacted them about it. They were super kind and professional and made sure we will get new plastic covers at no cost and also extended my warranty in case of future needs. I am now a very pleased customer! Would recommend this!!
customer_reviews.author: Billy Bob

customer_reviews.title: FED X
customer_reviews.text: Box came in terrible condition, Box all tore up, Straps broken. Left out side Building. Did not ring. Condo Number 205. Just got out of hospital. Should not of been moving 30#. Drug down hall to elevator. Then drug down 2nd floor to Apt 205. Will wait for son to open box and see if there is any damage inside box.
customer_reviews.author: William Westlake

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality- Not for Adult as the size max for 10 years kid
customer_reviews.text: Poor Quality- Not for Adult as the size max for 10 years kid - not safe to walk on - all the great reviews you see on Amazon for working out results are false - I try to return the product so many times nobody take action to get it back you will just lose 200$
customer_reviews.author: Inas

customer_reviews.title: Was great for 4 months......
customer_reviews.text: I had this treadmill since September and it worked fine up until the last week. I keep getting an E07 error code. I can't get anyone on the phone or a response to an email. I can't even find an error key anywhere to see what the problem even is. I am not happy I wasted money on this treadmill, I know it was cheap but I at least expected a year out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Tasia

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. Took me about 20 minutes. Low noise. Does not take up much space. I am 5’4 and feel like the treadmill is short (compared to gym treadmills). But for the price it does its job. There is no manual entry for weight and age so I am not sure how that affects the calorie calculation on the machine. I use the map my run app on treadmill mode to double check my calories burned and it seems to display that I have burned more calories than the treadmill says. Overall fantastic machine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, small treadmill!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little short but I love it! I’m a 5’9 female weighing 140lbs and it seems really study, just a little short for me. But I still recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: folding treadmill
customer_reviews.text: even though this machine was not working when delivered, I was able to make the fix with help from the supplier. They still owe me $30 for fixing their machine.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Niedzwiecki

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, needs stronger running board under belt
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking treadmill, however within 10 seconds of running on it the board underneath the belt cracked all the way down it. This is not a treadmill meant for anybody over 150 lbs to run on, even though it says up to 220 lbs. I tried to find a way to contact the seller to replace the board, but it did not give me the option to "Get help with order". Update: They've sent me a replacement, so i'm upgrading to 5 stars for their customer support.
customer_reviews.author: RKD

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs down.
customer_reviews.text: Not a good product. Hard to fold. Also, would have returned it but way to inconvenient to do so.
customer_reviews.author: CPA

customer_reviews.title: Don’t even go there
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for the treadmill was cheap and that is exactly how it performed I steady and keeps tripping my breaker , I even bought a Isobar surge protector to no avail Of course I can’t return the item because “ the window for return is closed” Bloody waste of time and money My advice buy something that might be a little bit more costly but will do what it is meant to do!
customer_reviews.author: Ola O

customer_reviews.title: I have not used this like I thought I would I find that it is ...
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this like I thought I would I find that it is hard to walk on it has a mushy feel to it. Maybe I just need to tighten the belt. does feel small.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little broken.
customer_reviews.text: Had a couple of pieces broken when it arrived. However not anything vital. Will just glue it together. Haven't used it yet. Has a click every time the seam comes around. Not sure what that means.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I LIKE IT
customer_reviews.text: This treadmill was pretty easy to put together. I like the small size very much but don't feel safe jogging on it so I just walk - because of the narrow track. So far no mechanical problems. It has had light use thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Love2Run9

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing service!! I would recommend them to anyone and everyone... this is a must get from an amazing businesss.
customer_reviews.author: Raouf

customer_reviews.title: Suits it's purpose
customer_reviews.text: Suits it's purpose and it's quiet as long as you keep your feet together but it's a bit narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Bachelors at 50

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: The machine is small. The runner in the picture must be four feet. I'm 5ft 3in and feel tall on the treadmill. Works good but hard on the shins.
customer_reviews.author: GERALDINE CRADDOCK

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, plugged it, got no response. Went over all the procedures, screen flickered, but could not get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie D.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have really been wanting a treadmill without breaking my checkbook. After looking at online reviews, I decided on this one. It's perfect for me! It's on the smaller side, which is fine, think apartment-sized. Was super easy to put together. My boyfriend had it out of the box and running for me in about 20 minutes. Easily folds up. I couldn't be happier with my purchase. I use it about 5 times a week, 45 minutes each time between 3 and 3.5 mph. So glad I bought this treadmill!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great..
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great....great price,...very easy to assemble, less than five minutes, very portable and easy to get out of the way...use it, fold it, shove it under the bed...heartily reccomend
customer_reviews.author: TeeCrawler

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t Meet Weight capacity
customer_reviews.text: Totally loved it from the moment I purchased it! It worked quite well didn’t occupy as much as space so that was a complete plus! However I had an issue, capacity weight is 220 lbs. My sister who was using it weighs 185 lbs, several days go by and I thought it had to do with the belt but fast forward a month after not occupying for safety reasons. I realized that the belt was not the issue but most of the bottom got cracked open. I’ve been trying to get in contact with customer service but that hasn’t worked. Is there any possible way this can be fixed?
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Cheap treadmill do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy it be aware it just recently broke it is made of cheap wood on the bottom and I am 165 pounds save your money please I bought it on April and today the bottom part broke in two
customer_reviews.author: Francis

customer_reviews.title: Made for SHORT People
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'9" and I have to bend over in order to reach a grip on the handles. I would not recommend this for anyone over 5'4" unless you have very long, long arms, which I do. I do not see an adjustment anywhere. There is no way for me to have a grip on the silver place where it monitors your heart. I will have to build up the handles some way. Otherwise, it serves me very well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne K. Nemitz

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I don't like is distnce is measured by metric
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use, ease of assembly, and ease of movement. The only thing I don't like is distnce is measured by metric. For the price, it is a bargin.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Burning Smell
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE: The company was super easy to work with, they apologized and were very quick to issue a full refund. I increased my rating to four stars because of this. **We have had this treadmill for 6 months. Use it almost every day and it started to have a burning smell. So we put some treadmill lubricant on it multiple times and it'll stop for a bit but the smell will come back very quickly. It worked well for a while and now it's basically useless unless you're walking for less than ten minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline Lightcap

customer_reviews.title: Works good!
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can use this treadmill in all kinds of weather every day! I like that it seems thus far to work great! Stay tuned!
customer_reviews.author: Julie A. Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: not the best but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Its Ok, not the best but you get what you pay for, there isn't a lot of room, i am a little fluffy and would like a little more room to stand on the belt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a joy to walk on
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoying my Merax.. It's a joy to walk on... I highly recommend this product....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly can't tell you if this treadmill even works. Since I plugged it in the panel came on then went off immediately so it won't come on. Sent email to merax, inc and they have answered promptly but the issue still exists. My sister-in-law has one and loves it. That is why I ordered mine, but so far have not been able to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and easy assemble.
customer_reviews.text: So easy to put together and doesn't take up much room.
customer_reviews.author: Tasnim I.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: It's to small speed is to slow it don't incline handle bars are a pain to tighten if not tighten all the way they fall towards you while on it...and company wants you to pay for it to go back Sonu just kept it definently do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Princess0129

customer_reviews.title: worth the money
customer_reviews.text: its not the big type but it does the job great for me. I am happy I did not spend more money on a bigger type.
customer_reviews.author: R. Singh

customer_reviews.title: It works for small people
customer_reviews.text: It works for me (5’3”) but if you’re looking for a treadmill that is wide and more comfortable, you need to look at something else.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Not Fast
customer_reviews.text: Small, light weight, compact. My only problem is that it says 6 speed but it’s almost equivalent to a 4.5 speed of the gym style treadmills. Perfect for walking slow or fast
customer_reviews.author: Gianinna Saa

customer_reviews.title: its pretty good
customer_reviews.text: for the price it works well. it is very skinny tho. not sure would work well for a taller/larger person. im 5'7 120lb. i may end up wishing id spent more on one with an incline, but for now, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jam

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Not powerful enough. But would work for someone that was needing physical therapy.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Bryeans

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Quality
customer_reviews.text: Was sent one with paint splattered all over the belt and a cracked handle. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Garlicbread

customer_reviews.title: Buy this now!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this treadmill! Just received it a few days ago but assembly was easy and the parts weren’t super heavy. Once it’s assembled, I can easily move it around my apartment thanks to the wheels. Not noisy so I can watch my tv shows while exercising. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mile95

customer_reviews.title: This is a scam
customer_reviews.text: This came with a broken screen, broken arms and a warped body. It was a emergency that I have this because I was rehabilitating my legs after a incident, now my life has to be put on the back burner because of these scammers and it could cost me. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: BLAKAT

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This item is crap. I've had it roughly a month and the bed broke. I weigh 196 pounds and there is a large hole under the belt where the plastic couldn't withstand my weight. I ran on it for 30 minutes every other day. Not only that, but the display broke after two weeks. Now I have to find out where I can throw away a $200 pile of junk. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. If you have big feet dont buy. It works good for my size eight. Im thankful to find this affordable treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: Paula D Adams

customer_reviews.title: perftect size for a small home
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my sister with health problems, it's a perfect size for her house
customer_reviews.author: cowboyslt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for limited space
customer_reviews.text: Great little treadmill for small spaces such as an apartment or small room. The belt is just wide enough to be able to walk, jog, or run. Wouldn’t say it’s very heavy duty, but it’s perfect for light to moderate workouts.
customer_reviews.author: als905223

customer_reviews.title: bad bad bad bad bad
customer_reviews.text: incredibly small. the belt was loose when i started using it, it doesnt fold up for me at all.
customer_reviews.author: Acadiaa

customer_reviews.title: You can't run on it as the description implies. ...
customer_reviews.text: You can't run on it as the description implies. The belt doesn't goes as fast at you run and then it says errors and stops.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Schlake

product_meta.title: Merax MS020307BAA JK1603E Easy Assembly Folding Electric Treadmill Motorized Running Machine
feature_bullets: Perfect size and folding design great for home Use and contains rolling wheels on the bottom providing simple Transport
Multi-functional display that allows user to Track progress in speed, distance, heart RATE and calories burned
An extremely low noise motor and a safety emergency Stop key for your safety, specially pleasant design including safe and convenient
Excellent deck provides useful cushioning for ankle, back and knee joints which helping your muscles recover faster from workout

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
